ygData.subject: Re: the soerbaird - question and or sick of hearing about it
ygData.msgSnippet: I hate the way people accuse, point fingers, and almost foam at the mouth whenever they feel the slightest injustice has been done to them.  Mellow out man!
ygData.messageBody:
I hate the way people accuse, point fingers, and almost foam at the mouth
whenever they feel the slightest injustice has been done to them. Mellow
out man! Ask first, see whats going on.

I'm not a Soerbaird, but I've been paying attention. As I understand it
they are still relatively new, and are still compiling these song lists and
help sections. They are probably focusing more on in game help for now,
until they can compile more in-depth song lists etc. Why would they bother
to re-hash the same information on bards you can get 100 other places on the
web? They can't help you without experience, and they can't get experience
until they level, and I can't see that they have enough high level people to
produce what you are DEMANDING.

Regretfully,
Gabriel

-----Original Message-----
From: John Rice <johnrice@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, April 27, 1999 10:49 PM
Subject: [eqbards] the soerbaird - question and or sick of hearing about it


>From: "John Rice" <johnrice@...>
>
>I've been to the soerbaird site, and it's very nice looking.
>You can see lots of bard tales and songs made up by people
>playing as bards in eq.
>
>However: Please! CORRECT ME IF I'M WRONG!
>
>Is all the actual nuts and bolts information you have
>compiled about bards locked behind passworded sections
>marked "Members Only"?
>
>I may be an idiot and unable to find the information I am
>actually interested in (specific tactics, song effects,
>bard quests, bard only magic items, bard faction information)
>and if so I apologize.
>
>But if I am correct that all such information is secreted away,
>then I have heard enough about the clique known as
>the soerbairds. If y'all want to go have your private little
>group and harvest a bunch of information which you then keep
>to yourself, then I for one don't want to hear the
>name of your clubby club on this list again. Any information
>that I am able to unearth about the bard profession is
>public knowledge as far as I'm concerned and I would be happy
>to have it repeated to any struggling or curious bard out there.
>
>If I missed a link or something, then I apologize in advance,
>and long live the soerbaird :P
>
>Berk Half-Elven
>Rallos Zek (a rough place
>to sing songs I might add)
>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: Randy Varnell [mailto:rvarnell@...]
>> Sent: Tuesday, April 27, 1999 5:14 PM
>> To: eqbards@onelist.com; eqbards@onelist.com
>> Subject: [eqbards] Re: Songs descriptions
>>
>>
>> From: Randy Varnell <rvarnell@...>
>>
>> Hail Roop and bards!
>>
>> This was an excellent list indeed. I'm compiling a smilar list for the
>> Soerbaird and love to hear what other bards have done with songs.
>>
>> One question I pose to all you bards out there: The Charismatic
Carillon--
>> I know a few of you have posted that you use this song, and that it has
at
>> least a minimal affect, but I have not even seen that much. My thinking
is
>> that the song has not yet been giving the blessing of the gods
>> (it is bugged).
>>
>> Also, could some one advise me of the appropriate way to use this song?
Do
>> I murmur it to myself, or do I serenade the shopkeeper with whom I wish
to
>> do business? Do I initiate the trade immediately after I sing, or
>> do I wait
>> a moment? How long do I have?
>>
>> I would advocate that this song is more effective than it
>> currently is, for
>> at the moment it seems to be making no difference in my buying. Of
course,
>> I am a VERY charming fellow already, and maybe I have found a limit to
the
>> amount dashing good looks can affect purchasing.
>>
>> Listen and Live!
>>
>>
>> -----------------------------------------------------
>> Jythri, Pencerdd of The Soerbaird
>> http://www.soerbaird.com
>>
>> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
>> Are you hogging all the fun?
>> http://www.ONElist.com
>> Friends tell friends about ONElist!
>>
